required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Steroid, Diuretic, and Fluid Use on BPD Outcomes
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Chart Review Evaluating the Impact of Steroid, Diuretic, and Fluid Use Practice Trends in Extreme Premature Infants at Risk for Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia (BPD) at a Single Center Neonatal Intensive Care Unit

lead_sponsor.agency: Mednax Center for Research, Education, Quality and Safety

clinical_study.source: Mednax Center for Research, Education, Quality and Safety

brief_summary.textblock: Assess the impact of steroid, diuretic, and fluid practices on BPD outcomes in extreme premature infants in the Banner - University Medical Center Phoenix (BUMCP) neonatal intensive care unit (NICU).

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators propose performing a retrospective analysis of the current respiratory management methods to potentially find a correlation between the number of steroid doses administered, the timing of initiation of steroid therapy and the effect on premature infants at risk for developing BPD. The investigators are also going to explore the number and timing of diuretic medications and average fluid intake.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the impact of steroid practices on BPD outcomes in these infants
primary_outcome.description: - The incidence of BPD stratified into three stages based on the type of support required at 36 weeks CGA

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the impact of steroid practices on BPD outcomes in these infants
To assess the impact of steroid practices on BPD outcomes in these infants
primary_outcome.description: - Administration of steroids to the infant

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine if steroid use has an impact on infant growth
secondary_outcome.description: - Collect growth and calculate the z-score at five intervals

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine if steroid use has an impact on NICU length of stay (LOS)

other_outcome.measure: To determine if the average fluid intake in the first week of life influences the severity of BPD
To determine if diuretic administration influences the severity of BPD
other_outcome.description: - If applicable, the DOL of first furosemide and/or chlorothiazide doses

arm_group.description: Infants born at <30 weeks and/or <1500g that were admitted to BUMCP between January 1, 2019 and December 31, 2020

intervention.description: This is a retrospective observational study and data will be collected from the subject's existing medical record. No interventions or procedures will be required for this study.

study_pop.textblock: Infants admitted to the BUMCP NICU at <30 weeks and/or <1500 grams (g)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infants born at <30 weeks and/or <1500g
- Admitted to BUMCP between January 1, 2019 and December 31, 2020
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infants that do not survive to 36 weeks CGA, when the determination of BPD is made
- Infants that are transferred to another hospital prior to 36 weeks CGA
- Out born infants
- Infants with life threatening congenital anomalies
- Investigator discretion as to other factors which might impact the study
